title: Problem syncing timed out DAO fork-check, dropping
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.4.10
OS & Version: Linux Ubuntu 14.04
#### Expected behaviour

Geth working as usual
#### Actual behaviour

I'm getting 'timed out DAO fork-check, dropping' all the time and it doesn't sync as it should. Sometimes, it syncs but then it start failing with this message and now the blockchain is 2,500 blocks ahead the other server I have with the same version of geth running on the same OS.
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

geth --rpc --support-dao-fork --rpcaddr 127.0.0.1 console

Thanks on advanced,
P/

I'm getting the same issue, but not on all machines. 

TEMPORARY WORKAROUND: is to restart geth via cron

I have this issue in one machine from 3, all with the same configuration (they are clones). I restarted several times and the issue wasn't fixed. 
Finally, the issue was gone. I hope it doesn't return because a popular wallet depends on this.

Same issue, though a cron job (via python script) creates new problem of sync restart from block 0.  
'timed out DAO fork-check, dropping' rate as of today is much less than 2 days ago, so fingers crossed it completes this time.

The "timed out" log is just a log anomaly (I forgot to top the timer if the peer disconnect before finishing the DAO challenge (e.g. remote side finished challenge and deemed to disconnect)). You can disregard it.

As for getting behind, I did find a bug (it was introduced quite some time ago, back in the EDGE release) that causes bad peers not to be dropped. It can lead to stalls in certain scenarios. This is also fixed on develop.

I'm further writing up two more patches to the downloader to make it less resource intensive and more flexible.
Also seeing the timed out messages.  My wallet is falling behind and not picking up transfers from the mining pool.

Getting all kinds of error since the hard forque. It has never synced since then

invalid receipt root hash
Unhandled trie error missing trie node
peer timed out DAO fork-check dropping

is there any update on this one?

it's a critical issue imo

My only solution to this was to make use of a Virtual Server third party instance, as my local connection, IP address or amount of memory were the issue.  A new instance, fresh IP, and plenty of bandwidth and memory seemed to allow me to sync.

$ geth --fast console 
(wait some time to download headers)
ctrl +c 
$ geth console
then it starts to download blocks.

Same issue, not able to update the chain since the hard fork. 
geth --fast or geth updatedb , generate the same message when getting close to block 1.920.000 DAO fork-check dropping

@nhq9765

> invalid receipt root hash
> Unhandled trie error missing trie node

These errors indicate a problem with your database and should be unrelated to the fork.

@gegemos

> geth updatedb

It should not be necessary to run this command.
We are looking into this issue.

I had the same issue. My fix was to remove the db completely and start fresh. Took a little under 2 hours.  I am on OSX but this probably works on other platforms.

I just closed everything. Opened up command prompt 
`geth removedb`  
`geth --fast --maxpeers 99 --cache 1024 --jitvm`

I then opened Mist and watched the blocks count down pretty quickly. 

The max peers I think helped with the speed as I believe it defaults to 25 and just forcing it to refresh completely didn't take long.  I did it with Geth 1.5 dev but it should work with 1.4.10 too. Good luck.
I can confirm the same issue. Trying now with the suggestion of @Lietmotiv

Happened here after 10sec  
 v1.4.10 

```
$ geth removedb
Removing chaindata...
Removed in 101.632µs
$ geth --fast --cache=1024 --maxpeers 99 --jitvm --support-dao-fork console 
> I0804 16:21:53.600968 eth/handler.go:295] Peer 6cb867ef9041ffc2 [eth/63]: timed out DAO fork-check, dropping
```

same after update

```
instance: Geth/v1.5.0-unstable/linux/go1.5.1/JIT
I0804 16:34:31.239409 eth/handler.go:294] Peer 788682eeee5245f5 [eth/63]: timed out DAO fork-check, dropping
```
Note that the message does not necessarily indicate a problem. Please give it some time to start the sync.
Any fix yet?

I0804 18:08:00.198441 eth/downloader/downloader.go:1087] Peer f6f1d91284650 [hs 0.00/s, bs 0.00/s, rs 0.00/s, ss 0.00/s, miss    0, rtt 20s]: head header set (item 0) broke chain ordering: requested 1919809, got 1920000
@fjl you were right, it was a non-issue here.

tks ! it is working now

On Thu, Aug 4, 2016 at 4:40 PM, Felix Lange notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Note that the message does not necessarily indicate a problem. Please give
> it some time to start the sync.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/2857#issuecomment-237573582,
> or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT0RVd0ILNHdgbLzsH7O6lpjc1kjwnP4ks5qcfnIgaJpZM4JTKiH
> .

Hey All.  I have been trying to figure this out for along time.  I am using windows, and when I synchronize my system clock to time.nist.gov, as described in this article: 
http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/6410-clock-synchronize-internet-time-server-windows-10-a.html

You can lookup how to sync your clock on whatever platform you are using (Linux, etc.)

The problem is fixed.  It then over time will slowly get worse, but if I resync my system clock it works again.

I tested it, and if your system clock is off by +-1 second, then it totally fails. and gives:
"timed out DAO fork-check, dropping"

I bet in the 0.8.1 update, they made the clock sync rules much more strict.  I assume they did this because it makes recursive attacks much more difficult if new pieces of code require time stamps, then the order the code is executed can be verified (given the DAO situation).

> I bet in the 0.8.1 update, they made the clock sync rules much more strict.

I can assure you that nothing has changed in this regard.

I too was getting the same message when I was trying to synch. I first tried synching my clock but that made no difference then I tried @Lietmotiv 's method and now it's working very quickly. 

> `geth removedb`
> 
> `geth --fast --maxpeers 99 --cache 1024 --jitvm`

If you're getting timed out, try this out because it might work for you like it did for me. I think that the problem is related to a connection issue.

Hello,
Again same issue today, geth 1.4.10 stopped syncing.

```
August 18th 2016, 04:00:47.000  ethereum    I0818 02:00:47.732758 core/blockchain.go:963] imported 0 block(s) (0 queued 97 ignored) including 0 txs in 826.533488ms. #2060297 [60a75d19 / 716a3563]
August 18th 2016, 04:00:46.000  ethereum    I0818 02:00:46.491786 core/blockchain.go:963] imported 0 block(s) (0 queued 2 ignored) including 0 txs in 13.98311ms. #2060162 [0fa77512 / 737ea164]
August 18th 2016, 04:00:46.000  ethereum    I0818 02:00:46.892381 core/blockchain.go:963] imported 0 block(s) (0 queued 38 ignored) including 0 txs in 224.434135ms. #2060200 [52fb0be3 / 420bb568]
August 18th 2016, 04:00:46.000  ethereum    I0818 02:00:46.168098 core/blockchain.go:963] imported 0 block(s) (0 queued 3 ignored) including 0 txs in 17.807034ms. #2060160 [b399db4c / 2f267a7b]
August 18th 2016, 04:00:39.000  ethereum    I0818 02:00:39.633898 core/blockchain.go:963] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 1 txs in 13.45657ms. #2091928 [d8257a94 / d8257a94]

```

I had same issues with version : 146, 148 and recently with 149 cf: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/2361

Thank you for your help!
Greg.

I had same issue since Sept 24, with instance: Geth/v1.4.12-stable/linux/go1.6.2. 

Any advice to fix it?

Getting the same issue on linux. tried resyncing multiple ways though always end up with: 
[eth/63]: timed out DAO fork-check, dropping
tried everything mentioned in this issue and beyond.
What internet connection do you have?

What do you mean?
using VPS, 1GPBS uplink
I've got one server running ETC (no problems) and one running ETH which is having issues....tried it on a fresh server all getting the same issues.

The fork check dropping think is mostly a log message, you shouldn't have problems if you have a good network link. Did you upgrade to Geth 1.4.13? It was released today and contains a fix to handle a currently ongoing DoS attack.
running Geth/1.5.0-unstable/go1.6.2/linux
